page.title: 13Religion in Dedham
page.content: St Mary's Church is a major tourist attraction, partly because it appears in many of Constable's paintings. It was built in 1492 with money from the Webbe and Gurdon families, wealthy cloth merchants. A few months ago the tower was being restored and the scaffolding spoilt tourists photographs. The vicar Rev. Norman Bedford came from Southwold in 1983. Our school goes to special services there and we sometimes hold our concerts in the Church because more people can attend. A Methodist Chapel near Bargate Lane crossroads has services every Sunday as well. The minister is Rev. D. Lang. The Congregational Chapel built in 1871 to replace an earlier Meeting House of 1739, closed for worship in 1980 and is now the Dedham Art Centre.
